snippet: The people of Cherán, Mexico, who say they have long been terrorized by an armed group of illegal loggers, rose up and took the law into their own hands.
abstract: People of Cheran, Mexico, drive out armed group of illegal loggers who had long terrorized the village and destroyed much of the nearby forests, and set up system of self-rule; residents have been allowed to govern themselves based on a legal framework established by the Mexican government called 'uses and customs' that has been granted to some indigenous communities.
lead_paragraph: The people of Cherán, Mexico, who say they have long been terrorized by an armed group of illegal loggers, rose up and took the law into their own hands.

headline.seo: In Mexico, Reclaiming the Forests and the Right to Feel Safe
headline.main: Reclaiming the Forests and the Right to Feel Safe
headline.print_headline: Reclaiming The Forests And the Right To Feel Safe
